metadata.title: CVE-2023-44487 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - high
metadata.description:
The HTTP/2 protocol allows a denial of service (server resourceconsumption) because request cancellation can reset many streams quickly,as exploited in the wild in August through October 2023.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-44487` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

haproxy - 2.0.31-0ubuntu0.2
vim-haproxy - 2.0.31-0ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

libnghttp2-14 - 1.40.0-1ubuntu0.2
nghttp2 - 1.40.0-1ubuntu0.2
nghttp2-client - 1.40.0-1ubuntu0.2
nghttp2-proxy - 1.40.0-1ubuntu0.2
nghttp2-server - 1.40.0-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

libnetty-java - 1:4.1.45-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: haproxy package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.31-0ubuntu0.2').
tomcat9 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
trafficserver package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
h2o package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
nghttp2 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.40.0-1ubuntu0.2').
nodejs package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
netty package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.1.45-1ubuntu0.2').
